Feds pursuing deportation of Obama's uncle to Kenya

Immigration officials will meet next week with Onyango Obama now that charges stemming from his drunken driving arrest have been resolved. (Globe, 2:16 p.m.)

Tornadoes tear through Dallas-Fort Worth area

Tornadoes ripped through the Dallas area today, tearing roofs, tossing trucks, and leaving flattened tractor trailers strewn about. (AP, 5:40 p.m.)

Board apologizes, student editor resigns after BU paper’s ‘joke’ spurs anger

Opinion | Kevin Cullen

The pulse of
Red Sox Nation

More than 80 percent of Massachusetts voters identify themselves as Red Sox fans, a figure that pollster Tom Jensen said is unique in the US.
editorial

Martha Coakley was right to prosecute Tim Cahill

By indicting the former state treasurer, a grand jury took an aggressive posture on the possible use of public money to bolster an elected official’s position.

Whistle-blower is still busy

Harry Markopolos is still pursuing new abuses after sounding an alarm about Bernard Madoff, but says he no longer fears physical attack.
art review

Making it real, color by color

The exhibit of prints by Janet Fish at the Smith College Museum of Art is cogent and lucidly instructive.
Boston Capital

Fidelity shines in growth stock rally

The fact that growth stocks are doing so well right now means Fidelity is having a great year.

Voters in Harvard and Ayer have torpedoed an affordable housing development for working families.

News

American woman who became world's oldest doctor dies at 114

Dr. Leila Denmark, the world's oldest practicing physician when she retired at age 103, died Sunday in Athens, Ga., her family members said. She was 114.

Budget getaways in New England
